definition: to have a fluent command of (idiom)
to move/to transport/to use/to apply/fortune/luck/fate
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
as/as if/such as

sentences.english: Leverage computer and Internet tools to make one's work more efficient.
sentences.chinese: 对计算机及因特网的技能运用自如，提高工作效率。

sentences.english: I admire her good command of the French language.
sentences.chinese: 我非常羡慕她对法语运用自如。

sentences.english: Special 5 interior pockets of wide buttom designed, vast capacity, grasp and apply skillfully.
sentences.chinese: 与众不同的五层宽底内页设计，超大容量，运用自如。

sentences.english: Heavily armoured soldiers, effective in the use of the hand gun and one handed axe.
sentences.chinese: 威尔士手炮兵身穿重甲，对手炮和战斧都运用自如。

sentences.english: Youll feel in command of your English.
sentences.chinese: 你会觉得你的英语运用自如。

sentences.english: Very few of us can use both of our hands equally well.
sentences.chinese: 我们当中很少有人能双手都运用自如。

sentences.english: GongDing was able to use freely many styles of poets and the art characters were distinct.
sentences.chinese: 公鼐对多种诗歌体裁运用自如，艺术特点鲜明。

definition: to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas
to operate (a machine etc) with ease
skillful/proficient
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
to reach perfection (idiom); a superb artistic achievement
practiced/proficient/skilled/skillful
lit. the stove fire has turned bright green (allusion to Daoist alchemy) (idiom)/fig. (of an art, a technique etc) brought to the point of perfection
as the arm moves the finger (idiom)/freely and effortlessly/to have perfect command of
grasp this fundamental point and all the rest will follow (idiom)
handling any occasion smoothly (idiom); equal to any situation
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
lit. ripe as a melon that rolls from its vine (idiom); fig. to know fluently/to know sth inside out/to know sth by heart
self-taught/to learn without a teacher (idiom)
lit. spirit and marrow/the essential character
to be proficient in
